Getting plants to grow and thrive under your care is a rewarding experience. Here are some terms you might find on your plant tag when you buy it:
Direct (bright): full sunlight for 6+ hours per day.
Indirect (partial): diffuse sunlight for 3–6 hours of the day. Avoid direct sunlight.
Low (shade): shady conditions, but some indirect light (less than 3 hours) is welcomed.
Tip: “full shade” does not mean a plant can survive in a windowless room. All plants require sunlight!
Low: once every 2 weeks, or when most of the soil is dry.
Moderate: once a week, or when first 1-2 inches of top soil has dried out.
High: 2-3 times a week, when top soil has dried out.
Misting: use to produce humidity and to help clean the leaves.
Water more often: in the summer
Water less often: in the winter
Humidity: some tropical plants do well when the leaves are misted.
Wipe both side of leaves with a soft damp cloth monthly.
Prune away leaves that are yellowed, browned, or withering.
Generally only needed every 1–2 weeks during the “growing months” = spring and summer.
A liquid variety works well for most indoor plants.
